page.title: 15WROXALL:THE ESTATE (2)
page.content:
The Estate includes several {woods,}one of which is Haywood. This is the second biggest in Warwickshire; it is 270 acres. All the woods have names and reasons for the names,e.g. Gilbert's Wood. In the woods sparrow- hawks,hawks and even buzzards,humming- birds and kingfishers can be seen.
There has been a{shoot}on the estate for many years,and at present there are 7 members. They shoot partridge, pheasant and woodcock. The season is between November and January. The size of the shoot varies.The dogs they take are Labradors and spaniels, and Prudey guns are used;these were named after a family in 1780.
